title: Accounting Intern (TO-43F6C)
requirements: Xactly Corporation was founded to solve an important challenge: how to help people everywhere connect and unleash their human potential through seamless, perfectly aligned Sales Performance Management. Xactly's comprehensive Sales Performance Management (SPM) suite leverages data from a sales performance AI platform to provide timely insights across the entire SPM value chain, from sales planning to execution, including compensation to optimization. Xactly takes Sales Performance Management from a dark art to a science, providing decision-makers with the data insights they need to tap the motivational power of their incentive compensation. With access to predictive analytics and benchmark data, enterprises can now optimize territories, design the right compensation and incentive plans and accelerate attainment and optimization of sales performance. Named among the best workplaces in the U.S. by Great Place to Work seven times, recognized as a 2020 WayUp Top 100 Internship Program named as a Top Workplace by the Bay Area News Group eight times as well as The Denver Post the last 3 consecutive years, and honored with the Business Intelligence Group Sales and Marketing Technology award in 2020. Xactly is proud to be disrupting the Sales Performance Management market space. We're building a culture of success and are looking for motivated professionals to join us! **THE OPPORTUNITY** Are you a career driven student looking to take your first step into the world of Accounting? Xactly, the leading sales performance management software company, is seeking a full-time Accounting Intern to support our Global Accounting team starting this summer 2021. This role is a 12-week internship starting in June 2021. As the Accounting Intern in Xactly Corporation's growing Denver office, you will have the opportunity to work alongside a world-class accounting team of experienced accountants and CPA's with exceptional work ethic and personalities. You will begin your internship by learning some of the foundational accounting activities such as accounts receivable, accounts payable, reconciliations and shadow some of our accountants in this "Best Place to Work" organization. Once acclimated, your day will consist of more challenging activities such as complex reconciliations, analysis, accounting projects and working with management on solutions to meaningful issues. These activities will help you gain exposure to other facets of accounting and a glimpse into what your career may look like in 5, 10 or even 20 years. Your summer internship will culminate in a final project, during which you will have the opportunity to present to Xactly's executive staff. On top of the above, you will participate in fun intern events, will learn a lot and will have a lot of FUN! **THE TEAM** Xactly's Accounting team is a group of remarkably smart, driven, and exceedingly fun people with diverse backgrounds. We are a team that puts people first! True believers in the Xactly Culture, the Accounting team ties Xactly's C.A.R.E. (Customer Focus, Accountability, Respect and Excellence) values into everyday things we do. Our team is made up of world-class big 4 CPA's, accounting management, young up-and-comers, and veterans. All of these people are ready to help you learn! **THE SKILL SET:** - Working towards a bachelor's degree with a graduation date between December 2021 - June 2023 - The desire to pursue a career in Accounting post-graduation - You have outstanding organizational skills - You're proactive, creative, entrepreneurial and results-oriented - You are able to prioritize requests based on importance and timing - You have a passion for learning and are results oriented **WITHIN ONE MONTH, YOU'LL:** - Develop a working relationship with Xactly's Accounting and Finance department - Have completed a 1:1 with each member of the Accounting and Finance teams and have a strong understanding of how Xactly's Accounting department operates - Receive administrative training on how to leverage internal tools including Box, Workday, Salesforce, Excel - Gain a strong understanding of Sales Performance Management space and the business challenges Xactly solves - Have a high-level understanding of the full lifecycle of an accounting close - Gain exposure and contribute to Accounting areas including general ledger, accounts payable, accounts receivable, revenue and management **BY THE END OF THE INTERNSHIP, YOU'LL:** - Have a strong understanding of how Xactly's accounting functions - Have the ability to learn each area of accounting to see what you like - Have a deep understanding of how our accounting processes and systems work - Successfully present your end-of-internship presentation to Xactly's executive staff Is this role not an exact fit for you? Keep an eye on our Careers Page for other positions

title: Accounting Intern (Summer 2021) - Remote
requirements:
This internship is remote based and applicants can be based within Eastern time zone.

Precisely is a global leader in data integrity, providing accuracy and consistency in data for 12,000 customers in more than 100 countries, including 90 percent of the Fortune 100. Precisely's data integration, data quality, location intelligence, and data enrichment products power better business decisions to create better outcomes. We are looking for talented individuals with the experience and motivation to join our innovative team.

Precisely is seeking an Accounting Intern who will join the Finance and Accounting team remotely and will be an individual contributor role focusing on global accounting close, audit and various other accounting initiatives.

The Opportunity Includes:
• A dynamic 10-week paid internship program
• Apply college learning and implement innovative solutions to real-world challenges
• Interaction, networking and exposure to various levels of leadership and management
• Amazing mentorship opportunities
• Top summer interns may be eligible to receive full time offers to join the team following the successful completion of their degree

Applicants must meet the following requirements:
• Ability to work 30 hours per week for 10 weeks
• Legally authorized to work in the United States without the requirement for future sponsorship
• Ability to work remotely which will require a working, reliable internet connection and a quiet and dedicated work space

Responsibilities
• Play role in monthly global accounting close process including preparing journal entries, expense accruals, account reconciliations and flux analysis
• Assist in support of the Company's external audits (and any quarterly or other interim reviews) for the consolidated company, and several foreign subsidiaries
• Coordinate GL activities with the shared services team
• Assist with special projects and process improvements
• Other related duties as assigned

Qualifications
• Currently enrolled in accredited college/university Bacheler's degree program in Junior or Senior year, pursuing degree in Finance or Accounting
• Prior accounting internship experience preferred
• Basic knowledge of US GAAP accounting concepts
• Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office Suite with strong Excel skills
• Ability and readiness to embrace and successfully drive/implement change
• Process optimization focused - vision with the ability to apply practical solutions and navigate through ambiguity
• High-level of integrity along with the ability to handle sensitive information and maintain confidentiality
• A strong work ethic, positive "can-do" attitude, and ability to meet deadlines
• Team player; comfortable operating within a dynamic, complex organizational structure and able to be flexible and collaborate with team on different projects and needs

title: 2021 Audit Intern
requirements:
BerryDunn is a CPA and Management Consulting firm with over 500 employees throughout the country that provide a full range of services including Management and IT Consulting, Health Analytics/Actuarial Consulting, Audit, Accounting, and Tax. With offices in Maine, New Hampshire, Massachusetts, Connecticut, West Virginia, and Arizona, BerryDunn has maintained steady growth over its 40+ year history, and the firm is regularly named to national “Top 100” lists, including recent recognition for being a “fastest-growing” firm. We partner with clients across the United States, and we attribute our growth to attracting, developing, and retaining outstanding employees who help our clients create, grow, and protect value.

At BerryDunn, you may have opportunities to work with clients in the industries of Health Care, Not-for-Profit, Financial Services, Manufacturing, Construction, Higher Education, and many others. Your work will be closely supervised through coaching and training, and you can expect to receive hands-on guidance from the supervisor, consultant, or principal in charge of the engagement.

You will receive extensive internal and external training on technical and soft skills, teamwork, and the firm’s systems, operations, and relationships. The firm expects you to demonstrate flexibility, have a willingness to seek out advice, and exhibit an ambition for learning.

Training provided will include: depreciation solution software (DSW), CaseWare for electronic workpapers, as well as internal office procedures.

Internships typically are from January – April 15th or May – August. (May be extended depending upon the co-op program or internship).
• Participating with team members on audit and review engagements supervised by senior staff members
• Work with CaseWare trial balance and document management software
• Utilize depreciation solution software (DSW) to calculate depreciation
• Work in one of our 4 main offices (Portland, ME, Bangor, ME, Manchester, NH and Waltham, MA) and at client locations depending upon availability
• Assist with special projects
• Works as an effective team member to complete project components and assignment tasks
• Builds working relationships at peer client level
• Seeks to gain knowledge of client businesses
• Effectively documents work
• Identifies task issues as well as task progress in a timely and organized manner
• Actively pursues self-development opportunities in line with the competency model
• Builds strong team relationship skills
• Ambassador to the universities
• Intermediate Accounting completed or in progress
• Available a minimum of 40 hours per week
• Basic computer skills in Microsoft Office, Microsoft Word, and Excel
• Strong interpersonal and relationship building skills
• Team player with a positive – ‘can do’ approach
• Strong communication skills
• A general and growing knowledge of firm products and services in the practice area, and a general knowledge of products and services in other practice areas
• A general understanding of market trends including opportunities, global and local business initiatives

EOE

title: Accounting Internship, Spring 2022
requirements:
At Wipfli, people count

Our people are core to everything we do - the catalyst behind our ability to create exceptional impact and extraordinary results.

We believe in flexibility. We focus on relationships. We encourage each individual to follow their own path. And we seek feedback openly, from all.

People matter here and they feel it.

And we value curiosity. Curious is more than a personality trait. It's a way of thinking. Of learning. Of working.

There's purpose in this wonder. It makes us better. It makes us Wipfli.

If you want to be in an environment where you can make a difference - and make a professional home - Wipfli is the place for you.

Check out our Glassdoor Reviews (https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Wipfli-Reviews-E39271.htm) to hear what people are saying about employment at Wipfli!

Apply now for our Accounting Internship, Spring 2022 out of Bedford, NH! Formerly Howe, Riley, & Howe, the firm is excited about joining forces with a continued focus on serving clients and making a difference in our communities!

Interns will be responsible for utilizing educational knowledge and experience to perform numerous accounting related responsibilities such as:

+ Respond to client and firm associate requests in a timely, accurate, positive and professional manner

+ Respond to inquiries from client and work with client to gather necessary information for completion of required documents

+ Use data analysis skills to discover useful information and patterns to provide support in recommendations

+ Proactively identify improvement opportunities in processes to enhance efficiency

Tax Specific:

+ Prepare individual, business and fiduciary tax returns and projections in accordance with firm and professional standards as directed by engagement leaders

+ Understand and effectively use current tax and accounting software applications

+ Research tax related issues and other related financial reports

+ Perform a limited number of tax return interviews as needed

Audit Specific:

+ Perform audit, review, and compliance testing procedures in accordance with firm an professional standards and as directed by engagement leaders

+ Communicate with engagement leaders regarding open items, testing problems, or other important matters in a timely manner

+ Prepare (or review client prepared) financial statements and footnotes, management reports, and other engagement outputs

+ Develop technical competency with GAAP, especially related to assigned product line

What You will Gain

+ Experience the Wipfli Way first hand while working side by side with professionals from all levels of the firm

+ Develop experience and skills to become a trusted business advisor for clients and associates

+ Gain hands-on experience in tax and/or audit work, and related software applications

+ Work as an individual contributor and as part of a team to support client engagements

+ Gain exposure to a variety of clients and industries ranging from small businesses to large corporations

+ Develop administrative, professional, and interpersonal skills to the extent of being able to organize, analyze, and communicate with others in a productive and efficient manner

+ Pursuing a Bachelors or Master's degree in Accounting (completion of corporate or individual taxation class is required)

+ Above average competency in accounting as demonstrated by college GPA; Minimum 3.2 GPA

+ Working towards eligibility to sit for CPA exam upon graduation (150 credits)

+ Preferred coursework in Data Analytics or Big Data

+ Ability to think independently and make good decisions based on education and experience

+ Good communication and interpersonal skills to effectively communicate with clients and staff

+ Ability to prioritize work, follow through on requests, take initiative and meet deadlines

Our recruiting team will guide you through our evaluation and interviewing process. We will communicate an update on your status as soon as possible. The recruiting team member guiding you through this process is Jane Welch, and you can find her on LinkedIN Here (https://www.linkedin.com/in/janeawelch2375/) . She is based in our Madison, WI office and looks forward to guiding you through this process.

Wipfli is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All candidates will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identify, citizenship status, veteran status, disability, or any other characteristics protected by federal, state, or local laws.

Don't See Your Dream Job? Connect With Us!

Don't see a current position posted for your area of interest, specialty, or are not ready to formally apply at this time?

Use thefeature to forward your information to a member of our recruiting team. We will reach out to you very soon and will also keep you posted on any new positions as they become available. (https://careers-wipfli.icims.com/connect?back=intro&in\_iframe=1&hashed=-435708796)

Job LocationsUS-NH-Bedford

Job ID2020-3578

CategoryEntry-Level/Internships

title: Intern, IES Revenue Accounting Technical
requirements:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That's why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it's the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people's lives.

Contract Duration: 6 months

Contract Hours: 40 hours/week

Anticipated Start Date: March 29, 2021

Office Location: VIrtual and upon Office opening Newtown Square, PA

Work Area: Fiori App development

- Conversational AI chatbot
- ABAP Development
- Functional Consulting
- Requirements Gathering / Testing

PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES

Intelligent Enterprise Solutions (IES) provides efficient IT solutions, technology, and operational support to our Lines of Businesses (LoBs) with a strong focus on user-centricity. Supporting more than 100,000 employees and thousands of SAP systems, IES is delivering business applications be it classical SAP or new SaaS solutions, mobile apps, web & HANA Cloud Platform-based applications, as well as workplace technology services covering hardware, client software, and unified communications solutions.

The IES Cash Collections & Revenue Accounting CoE within the IES Business Solutions organization consults, implements & operates IT solutions to make internal SAP Global Finance & Accounting teams more productive & help SAP run at its best. The team supports processes in Revenue recognition, Cash Collection, and Credit Card Handling.

The IES Cash Collections & Revenue Accounting CoE would like to engage motivated interns and provide the opportunity for further development. This is your opportunity to:

- Gain systems design and analysis experience
- Work on SAP Fiori App development and SAP Conversational AI (CAI) chatbot development
- Work in a highly motivated international team
- Manage and take responsibility for own defined tasks in an Agile setup
- Get to know the area of technical consulting as well as the internal revenue recognition process

EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS

- Understand the revenue recognition process and the implementation of SAP RAR (Revenue Accounting & Reporting) module within SAP
- Develop ABAP reports based on end-user requirements
- Develop SAP Fiori Apps
- Add new capabilities to the Revenue Accounting CAI chatbot
- Enhance existing functionalities by identifying critical pain points and proposing solutions
- Contribute to a key stable team within an Agile framework

title: Tax Intern (Summer 2021) - Remote
requirements:
This internship is remote based and applicants can be based within Eastern time zone.

Precisely is a global leader in data integrity, providing accuracy and consistency in data for 12,000 customers in more than 100 countries, including 90 percent of the Fortune 100. Precisely’s data integration, data quality, location intelligence, and data enrichment products power better business decisions to create better outcomes. We are looking for talented individuals with the experience and motivation to join our innovative team.

The primary responsibilities of the Tax Intern are to assist with transactional tax returns/payments, review invoices for the determination of accurate transactional tax, assist in preparation of income tax return, and assist with other tax department responsibilities.

The Opportunity Includes:
• A dynamic 10-week paid internship program
• Apply college learning and implement innovative solutions to real-world challenges
• Interaction, networking and exposure to various levels of leadership and management
• Amazing mentorship opportunities
• Top summer interns may be eligible to receive full time offers to join the team following the successful completion of their degree

Applicants must meet the following requirements:
• Ability to work 30 hours per week for 10 weeks
• Legally authorized to work in the United States without the requirement for future sponsorship
• Ability to work remotely which will require a working, reliable internet connection and a quiet and dedicated work space

US Sales and Use Tax
• Prepare data to send to service provider for sales and use tax return compliance
• Assist with sales tax exemption certificates storage, entry, and maintenance
• Provide support on internal and external sales tax inquiries
• Assist with sales & use tax audits
• Review purchase invoices to determine applicable use tax
• Reconcile sales and use tax accounts

International Transactional Tax (i.e. VAT/GST)
• Prepare and file international transactional tax returns
• Assist with international transactional tax audits
• Review international sales and purchase invoices to confirm applicable tax
• Reconcile international transactional tax accounts

Income Tax
• Assist with preparation of tax provision
• Gather required information needed for income tax return preparation, credits, and incentives
• Review tax return calculations
• Prepare provision-to-return analysis
• Prepare quarterly estimated tax payment and extension payment calculations

Other Items
• Update and maintain tax calendars by legal entity
• Prepare and file property tax returns
• Prepare tax related payment requests
• Ensure global tax returns and payments are processed in a timely and accurate manner
• Prepare journal entries
• Performs ad-hoc projects and process improvement initiatives as assigned
• Resolves notices and assessments from tax authorities
• Assists with filing business licenses
• Assist in tax planning and research
• Enrolled in Bachelor’s degree program as a Junior, pursuing degree in Accounting, Finance, or Tax
• Basic knowledge of US GAAP accounting concepts
• Excellent initiative and drive
• Written and verbal communication skills
• Organizational and time management skills
• Handles and safeguards confidential information and sensitive information

Preferred Qualifications:
• Prior accounting internship experience
• Proficient in MS Office Suite with strong Excel skills and ability to learn and utilize other systems/software
• Ability to analyze and problem solve
• Ability to multi-task and accurately work with numbers, deadlines, and details
• Adjust readily to change and adapt as needed
• Ability to execute instructions and to request clarification when needed
